args.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject (a text, object, practice, structure, or action) is intended or employed to achieve the object as its purpose, function, or ultimate goal.
args.justification: All six relations connect funerary texts, practices, or structures to the intended afterlife goal or benefit (helping the deceased, reaching or existing in the realm of the gods). They already share the same canonical_rel_name and a very similar rel_cls and rel_cls_group; the only inconsistency is minor wording differences in canonical_rel_desc. Unifying them under a single, slightly generalized description improves schema consistency while preserving the intended semantics of a purpose/functional-usage relation.

executed_decisions.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject (a text, object, practice, structure, or action) is intended or employed to achieve the object as its purpose, function, or ultimate goal.
executed_decisions.justification: All six relations connect funerary texts, practices, or structures to the intended afterlife goal or benefit (helping the deceased, reaching or existing in the realm of the gods). They already share the same canonical_rel_name and a very similar rel_cls and rel_cls_group; the only inconsistency is minor wording differences in canonical_rel_desc. Unifying them under a single, slightly generalized description improves schema consistency while preserving the intended semantics of a purpose/functional-usage relation.
